title: Srimad Bhagavatam 3.16.20 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: the goddess of fortune Lakshmi the dust of whose feet is worn on the head by others waits upon you as appointed for she is anxious to secure a place
segments.summary: The speaker recites and explains a verse describing Lakshmi's eagerness to serve the Lord's lotus feet, where Tulasi is always present.
segments.transcript: is anxious to secure translation and purport by His Divine Grace A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, translation: the goddess of fortune, Lakshmi, the dust of whose feet is worn on the head by others, waits upon you as appointed, for she is anxious to secure a place in the abode of the king of bees who hovers on the fresh wreath of Tulasī leaves offered at your feet by some blessed devotee. Please repeat this translation: the goddess of fortune, Lakshmi, the dust of whose feet is worn on the head by others, waits upon you as appointed, for she is anxious to secure a place in the abode of the king of bees who hovers on the fresh wreath of Tulasī leaves offered at your feet by some blessed devotee.

segments.key_quote: the conclusion is that no one can be the benefactor of the lord everyone is actually the servant of the servant of the lord
segments.summary: The speaker reads Srila Prabhupada's purport, emphasizing that no one can favor the Lord, as everyone is a servant of His servant.
segments.transcript: Purport by Srila Prabhupada: as previously described, Tulasī has attained all superior qualities due to being placed at the lotus feet of the Lord. The comparison made here is very nice: as the king of bees hovers over the Tulasī leaves offered to the lotus feet of the Lord, so Lakshmi, the goddess who is sought by the demigods, brahmanas, Vaishnavas, and everyone else, always engages in rendering service to the lotus feet of the Lord. The conclusion is that no one can be the benefactor of the Lord; everyone is actually the servant of the servant of the Lord. Rajottam Das ends the Bhaktivedanta purport.

segments.key_quote: They are reiterating that the Lord cannot be favoured by anybody. His position is that he only gives favours to others.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the Lord is independent and only gives favors, providing opportunities for others to serve Him for their own benefit.
segments.transcript: So this is a verse spoken by the Kumaras. They are addressing the Supreme Lord Narayana. They are reiterating that the Lord cannot be favored by anybody. His position is that He only gives favors to others. He does not receive any favors from anybody. He gives an opportunity for others to serve Him for their own benefit, not for His benefit.

segments.key_quote: So here it is being described by Kumaras that the Goddess of Fortune, Lakshmi, what is her position actually? She is, the dust of her feet is worn on the head by others
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Lakshmi's position and her desire to serve the Lord's lotus feet, highlighting Tulasi's permanent presence there due to her devotion.
segments.transcript: So here it is being described by Kumaras that the Goddess of Fortune, Lakshmi, what is her position actually? She is, the dust of her feet is worn on the head by others. Who are the others? Prabhupada says in the purport: those who are seeking the Goddess of Fortune are the Devatas, the Brahmanas, the Vaishnavas, and everyone else, they are seeking blessings, the favor, the mercy of the Goddess of Fortune. That Goddess of Fortune, she waits upon the Supreme Lord Narayana, Lakshmi Narayana, correct? So Lakshmi waits upon Narayana, for she is anxious to secure a place in the abode of the King of Bees, which is the abode of the King of Bees: Madhu, Vrata, Pater, Dhamma, Dhamnaha. The King of Bees actually is hovering over the fresh Tulasī leaves, which are all over the place, always permanently situated at the lotus feet of the Lord. So the lotus feet of the Lord is the most desired place in the entire Vaikuntha.

segments.key_quote: regarding the nine types of devotional service one particular service among the nine types concerns the lotus feet of the Lord which is that service Pada Sevanam
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the concept of Pada Sevanam, one of the nine types of devotional service, which relates to serving the lotus feet of the Lord.
segments.transcript: Sometimes she is worshipping the lotus feet of the Lord, like that, different services. So regarding the nine types of devotional service, one particular service among the nine types concerns the lotus feet of the Lord, which is that service? Pada Sevanam.

segments.key_quote: Prahlad was not interested in learning all that he had already learnt whatever he had to learn when he was in the mother's womb he had learnt from Narada about Bhakti and that is the highest education
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Prahlad Maharaj, who, despite his father's expectations, valued bhakti as the highest form of knowledge.
segments.transcript: Now, many times devotees think Pada Sevanam means we should actually approach the lotus feet of the Lord and actually render service, but in the purport to one particular verse, which is that verse? The verse which describes the nine types of devotional service is spoken by Prahlad Maharaj. Once Hiranyakashipu called his son, after he had finished some Gurukul education, said, "What is the best of what you have learnt in the Gurukul?" So he was expecting the son will tell something about economic development, sense gratification, administration, politics, diplomacy. That's what he wanted his son to learn, and that's what the teachers also were willing to teach in the Gurukul, Shanda and Amarka, two sons of Shukracharya. Instead, Prahlad was not interested in learning all that. He had already learnt whatever he had to learn when he was in the mother's womb. He had learnt from Narada about Bhakti, and that is the highest education, highest knowledge, king of all knowledge. That's what Krishna says in the ninth chapter, Raja Vidya. What is that Raja Vidya? Bhakti is the highest knowledge of all knowledge, Bhakti, pure devotional service. So that he had already learnt.

segments.key_quote: tell me what is the best of what you have learnt then he is telling Shravanam Kirtanam Vishno Smaranam Pada Sevanam Archanam Vandanam Dasyam Sakhyam Atma Nivedanam
segments.summary: The speaker lists the nine processes of devotional service as described by Prahlad Maharaj.
segments.transcript: So for him there is no need to learn anything else. So when his father asked, "Tell me what is the best of what you have learnt," then he is telling, Shravanam Kirtanam Vishno Smaranam Pada Sevanam Archanam Vandanam Dasyam Sakhyam Atma Nivedanam, this is the...

segments.key_quote: so while describing this Pada Sevanam Prabhupada is telling in that purport according to one's taste and strength hearing, chanting and remembrance may be followed by Pada Sevanam
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's purport on Pada Sevanam, emphasizing that intensely thinking of the Lord's lotus feet is a form of service.
segments.transcript: So while describing this Pada Sevanam, Prabhupada is telling, in that purport, according to one's taste and strength, hearing, chanting, and remembrance may be followed by Pada Sevanam. This is number four in that list of nine varieties of devotional service. First is Shravanam, second one is Kirtanam, third one is Smaranam, so after that, fourth one is Pada Sevanam. So Shravanam, Kirtanam, Smaranam, Pada Sevanam are the four kinds of devotional service. Shravanam, Kirtanam, Smaranam, Pada Sevanam are the four kinds of devotional service: hearing, chanting, remembrance. The fourth one is Pada Sevanam. One obtains the perfection of remembering when one constantly thinks of the lotus feet of the Lord. The perfection of remembrance of the Lord is possible when one constantly thinks of the lotus feet of the Lord. Being intensely attached to thinking of the Lord's lotus feet is called Pada Sevanam. See, we should carefully read and hear. We think Pada Sevanam means go and serve the lotus feet, which is correct, serving the lotus feet of the Lord, but what are the ways in which you can serve the lotus feet of the Lord? One of the ways is intentionally, intensely thinking, intensely attached to thinking of the lotus feet of the Lord is called Pada Sevanam, you see, intensely attached to thinking of the...

segments.key_quote: In the nine steps of development of Bhakti, which is that step? Intense attachment for devotional service. First one is Asakti.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Asakti, intense attachment for devotional service, as a step in the development of Bhakti.
segments.transcript: grabbing something crêped and they are not just attached to these services that intense attachment wanna be a person after a certain day or that intense attachment is congested even effort of getting attached to serve a certain task this need not to be too lonely another servicehang the service In the nine steps of development of Bhakti, which is that step? Intense attachment for devotional service. First one is Asakti. First one is Shraddha. Second one is Sadhu Sangha. Quick, quick, quick. Third one. Bhajana Kriya. Fourth one. Anartha Nivritti. Fifth one. Nishta. Ruchi. Sixth one is Asakti. Among the nine. Steps. Nine steps or eight steps? Not sure. Nine steps. Nine steps are there. Seventh one is? Sixth one I said is? No. Once again. Shraddha. Sadhu Sangha. Bhajana Kriya. Anartha Nivritti. Nishta. Ruchi. Asakti. Bhava. Prema. Nine different steps are there. The ninth step is Prema. The highest perfection. So Asakti means intense attachment for devotional service to the Lord. Intense attachment.

segments.key_quote: What is the characteristic of intense attachment? Attachment we all know. Because we already have some attachments, material attachments. What is the characteristic of intense attachment? Absorbed in thinking is intense attachment for thinking.
segments.summary: The speaker defines intense attachment in devotional service, using the example of a devotee constantly chanting Hare Krishna.
segments.transcript: What is the characteristic of intense attachment? Attachment we all know, because we already have some attachments, material attachments. What is the characteristic of intense attachment? Absorbed in thinking is intense attachment for thinking. Yes, that's correct. But what is the symptom of, let us say, somebody is intensely attached to chanting? What is the symptom of such a person? What can we say? Eagerness to chant more. But how do we know that he has got eagerness to chant more? Huh? Always chanting. Constantly chanting. What is the astakur? What is he doing? Always chanting. Three lakh names a day. Almost 24 hours. Almost 24 hours chanting Hare Krishna. So that is intense attachment for devotional service. So Prabhupada in many places he says a pure devotee is 24 hours daily engaged in serving the Lord. That is because of intense attachment to serving the Lord. So one way of Pada Sevanam that's distinctly described here in the purport is being intensely attached to thinking of the Lord's Lotus Feet. Intensely attached to thinking means always want to think of the Lord's Lotus Feet.

segments.key_quote: So one way of Pada Sevanam that's distinctly described here in the purport is being intensely attached to thinking of the Lord's Lotus Feet. Intensely attached to thinking means always want to think of the Lord's Lotus Feet.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that intensely thinking of the Lord's lotus feet is a form of Pada Sevanam.
segments.transcript: Intensely attached to thinking means always want to think of the Lord's Lotus Feet.

segments.key_quote: In Nectar of Instruction in the purport to the eighth verse of Nectar of Instruction. In the purport Srila Prabhupada gives the Anubhasha of Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswari Thakur.
segments.summary: The speaker references the Nectar of Instruction and Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur's teachings on the importance of chanting and hearing, leading to a desire to serve in Vrindavan.
segments.transcript: In Nectar of Instruction, in the purport to the eighth verse of Nectar of Instruction, in the purport Srila Prabhupada gives the Anubhasha of Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur. In that Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur... doing sadhana bhakti and wants to make progress. So first of all, Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur says, one must follow the rules and regulations and engage in chanting and hearing about the name, fame, glories, activities, etc. of the Supreme Lord. Then this will lead to constantly doing it. What? Chanting and hearing. Constantly doing this. Then, when one becomes fixed up in chanting and hearing regularly, constantly, then one wants to actually render specific service to the Supreme Lord in Vrindavan.

segments.key_quote: Now Vrindavan is not just the physical place Vrindavan, that is Vrindavan of course, but any place where the glories of the Lord are sung by devotees who are dedicated for such glorification.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Vrindavan is not just a physical place but anywhere the Lord's glories are sung by dedicated devotees, emphasizing the importance of association with devotees.
segments.transcript: Now Vrindavan is not just the physical place Vrindavan, that is Vrindavan of course, but any place where the glories of the Lord are sung by devotees who are dedicated for such glorification. It's like all temples of the Krishna Consciousness Movement. This is Vrindavan. Wherever pure devotees are chanting or singing the glories of the Lord, that is also Vrindavan. So all such places one wants to reside, any of such places one wants to reside and render service, the same service, constantly engaged in chanting and hearing. Then that leads to, chanting and hearing leads to constant chanting and hearing, by following the rules. Constant chanting and hearing leads to residing in a holy place in Mathura or in Vrindavan, in order to do such service. That means one wants to do this service, devotional service, in the association of devotees.

segments.key_quote: Just like many times, those who are staying outside and practicing devotional service seriously, they feel that they should also stay in such a temple and do seva.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the impetus for joining a temple to be amidst devotees and engage fully in devotional service, addressing the idea that Prabhupada didn't give practical tips.
segments.transcript: Just like many times, those who are staying outside and practicing devotional service seriously, they feel that they should also stay in such a temple and do seva, because they can make out the difference, right? For at least some of us, it would have been the impetus to join, so that we can nicely stay amidst devotees and do seva. We might have been doing seva outside, but one of the impetus for joining is, we can stay amidst devotees and completely engage in devotional service. So similarly, Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur explains, that a progressive devotee goes through these stages. I will read that portion in Nectar of Instruction, because sometimes devotees think that Prabhupada has not given details beyond sadhana bhakti, how to execute sadhana bhakti practically. Practical tips, practical description Prabhupada has not given. Actually he has given that.

segments.key_quote: If you refer nectar of instruction, that purport to the 8th verse. The 8th verse itself is important. You should know what the 8th verse is. The most important verse in nectar of instruction.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the importance of the 8th verse of the Nectar of Instruction, emphasizing the need to utilize one's full time in chanting and remembering the Lord.
segments.transcript: If you refer Nectar of Instruction, that purport to the 8th verse. The 8th verse itself is important. You should know what the 8th verse is. The most important verse in Nectar of Instruction. The essence of all advised, iti upadesha saram. This book is called Upadesha Amrita, Nectar of Instructions. Among all the instructions, which is the essence of all these instructions, the 8th verse. What is that? The essence of all instructions is that one should utilize one's full time. What is full time? 24 hours a day. How many hours are there in the day? 24 hours. All the time. In nicely chanting and remembering the Lord's divine name, transcendental form, qualities, and eternal pastimes.

segments.key_quote: Thereby gradually engaging one's tongue and mind. In this way, one should reside in Vraja.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that residing in Vraja involves engaging one's tongue and mind in chanting and remembering the Lord.
segments.transcript: Thereby gradually engaging one's tongue and mind. Two things. Engaging one's tongue and mind. Kramena rasana manasi niyodhya. In this way, one should reside in Vraja. See, residing in Vraja is not that I want to shift to Vrindavan. By full time engaging in nicely chanting and remembering the Lord's divine name, form, qualities, eternal pastimes, thereby gradually engaging one's tongue and mind, in this way reside in Vraja and serve Krishna

segments.key_quote: And serve Krishna under the guidance of devotees. Obviously more advanced devotees. One should follow in the footsteps of the Lord's beloved devotees who are deeply attached to his devotional service.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of serving Krishna under the guidance of advanced devotees who are intensely attached to devotional service.
segments.transcript: under the guidance of devotees. Obviously more advanced devotees. One should follow in the footsteps of the Lord's beloved devotees who are deeply attached to his devotional service. Intense attachment. Same thing. So in the purport, it's a very big purport, I'll read this portion of Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur's... So he says, one who has not yet developed interest in Krishna consciousness should give up all material motives and train his mind by following the progressive regulated principles, namely chanting and remembering Krishna and his name, form, quality, pastimes, and so forth. Chanting and remembering. Rasana manasi niyodhya. Tongue. You have to vibrate the tongue. Not chanting in the mind. Chanting by vibrating the tongue. And of course, one has to engage the mind in remembering. So for remembering in the mind, one has to not only chant, one should also hear. Chanting and hearing constitutes remembrance. Attentively. Chanting and hearing attentively constitutes remembrance. So here, one should practice without material motives chanting and remembering Krishna and his name, form, quality, pastimes. In this way, after developing a taste for such things, for chanting and remembering constantly, one should try to live in Vrindavan and pass his time constantly remembering Lord Krishna's name, fame, pastimes, and qualities under the direction and protection of an expert devotee.

segments.key_quote: So for physically residing in Vrindavan, the time is when one has trained his mind by following the regulated principles.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that physically residing in Vrindavan is appropriate when one has trained their mind by following regulated principles and seeks guidance from an expert devotee.
segments.transcript: ... So for physically residing in Vrindavan, the time is when one has trained his mind by following the regulated principles. Then one has to actually go and reside in Vrindavan, because then what happens? There is a necessity of seeking direction and protection of an expert devotee. Such an expert devotee actually is one, as described in the verse, who is intensely attached to chanting and hearing and remembering the Supreme Lord. Such a devotee, under such a devotee's guidance. This is the sum and substance of all instruction regarding the cultivation of devotional service. Over. Finished. This much, Prabhupada has given everything. Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur

segments.key_quote: So how serious we have to become about chanting, hearing, attentively, and thereby remembering and doing it constantly.
segments.summary: The speaker stresses the importance of serious chanting and hearing, and efficiently managing other activities to maximize time for devotional service.
segments.transcript: has given everything. So how serious we have to become about chanting, hearing, attentively, and thereby remembering and doing it constantly. Constantly means in our present state, practically speaking. 24 hours we cannot do in our present condition. So at least the minimum expected service, we should do. 16 rounds at least we should nicely chant and hear attentively. Then after that we have to increase this chanting and hearing attentively. We have to increase and fill all available time with such chanting and hearing attentively. All available time. So for which we have to become efficient in doing other activities which are not necessarily direct devotional service. All such other activities we have to efficiently do

segments.key_quote: Generally, people think they should do important activities or some activities efficiently means maximum time they should spend on that. But here it is a reverse. Bodily maintenance. Minimum time.
segments.summary: The speaker advises efficient time management for bodily maintenance to save time for increasing chanting, hearing, and remembering the Lord.
segments.transcript: in minimum possible time. Generally, people think they should do important activities or some activities efficiently means maximum time they should spend on that. But here it is a reverse. Bodily maintenance. Minimum time. It doesn't mean we become dirty and we don't care for cleansing the body or feeding the body. No. We have to. We cannot neglect that. But efficiently we should do in such a way that minimum time is spent, so that we save time for increasing chanting, hearing, remembering the Lord's holy name, qualities, pastimes, etc.

segments.key_quote: So, next, Srila Bhaktisiddhant Sri Thakur describes particular stages of development of this perfection of devotional service. Stages. He gives names.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur's description of the stages of development in devotional service, starting with Shravanadasha (the stage of hearing).
segments.transcript: That is the idea. So, next, Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur describes particular stages of development of this perfection of devotional service. Stages. He gives names. Now these names you should actually remember. Just like we understand from Rupa Goswami's Bhakti Rasamrita Sindhu, Shraddha, Sadhu Sangha, Bhajanakriya, Anartha Nivritti, Nishta, like that. Here also names are given for the development of stages of progress in this particular way. In the neophyte stage one should always engage in hearing Krishna Katha. We are all neophytes. So we should always engage in hearing Krishna Katha. This is called Shravanadasha. The stage of hearing.

segments.key_quote: This is the beginning. Shravanam, Kirtanam, Vishnu. Beginning of Navavida Bhakti. Shravanam.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Shravanadasha is the beginning of devotional service and progresses to Varanadasha through constant hearing of Krishna's name, form, qualities, and pastimes.
segments.transcript: This is the beginning. Shravanam, Kirtanam, Vishnu. Beginning of Navavida Bhakti. Shravanam. Prabhupada in many places says, devotional service begins with hearing. So, Shravanadasha. Neophyte devotee means Shravanadasha. By constantly hearing the transcendental holy name of Krishna and hearing of his transcendental form, qualities, pastimes, one can attain to the stage of acceptance called Varanadasha. So we are all in this Shravanadasha. We are to progress to Varanadasha. Varanadasha means that same chanting, hearing, etc. becomes constant. By constantly hearing the transcendental holy name of Krishna, hearing of his pastimes, form, qualities, etc., one comes to the stage of Varanadasha. That is the second stage. Shravanadasha, Varanadasha.

segments.key_quote: When one attains this stage, Varanadasha, he becomes attached to hearing Krishna Katha.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Varanadasha leads to attachment to hearing Krishna Katha, which requires sincere service to the spiritual master.
segments.transcript: Then, when one attains this stage, Varanadasha, he becomes attached to hearing Krishna Katha. Remember the verse in the Bhagavatam, first canto, second chapter, Vasudeva Katha Ruchihi Syaat. There, Suta Goswami states, that the Suta Goswami is telling one should render service to the pure devotee, spiritual master, to develop this Vasudeva Katha Ruchi. Sushusho Shraddadhanasya Vasudeva Katha Ruchihi Syaat. So, unless we serve the spiritual master sincerely, without any material motive, without any reservation, unless we serve sincerely, we can't develop this taste for hearing.

segments.key_quote: We are all engaged in chanting and hearing, but to constantly chant and hear, what is required? A taste is required.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that developing a taste for hearing is essential for constant chanting and hearing, leading to chanting in ecstasy and reaching Smarana Dasha.
segments.transcript: Without taste, who can do anything constantly? Not possible. We are all engaged in chanting and hearing, but to constantly chant and hear, what is required? A taste is required. And to develop the taste, one must sincerely render service to the spiritual master according to his instructions. So, Varana Dasha leads to becoming attached to hearing Krishna Katha. When one is able to chant in ecstasy, he comes to the Smarana Dasha, Smarana Dasha, chanting in ecstasy. This is called Smarana Dasha. This constant chanting and hearing, that is the stage of Varana Dasha. Varana Dasha leads to attachment to hearing. When one becomes attached to hearing, then one is able to chant in ecstasy. One is able to chant in ecstasy. This is called Smarana

segments.key_quote: Now, the five progressive stages of Krishna Smarana, remembering Krishna, five stages, Smarana Dasha, recollection, absorption, meditation, constant remembrance and trance.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the five progressive stages of Krishna Smarana, starting with recollection, where remembrance may be interrupted.
segments.transcript: Dasha. Now, the five progressive stages of Krishna Smarana, remembering Krishna, five stages, Smarana Dasha, recollection, absorption, meditation, constant remembrance and trance. This is the five sub-stages. First one is recollection. So, Srila Prabhupada explains what is that recollection. At first, remembrance of Krishna may be interrupted at intervals. In the beginning, one may not be able to constantly remember Krishna. So, that is when interruption is there,

segments.key_quote: Again, you want to get back to that chanting, hearing and remembrance. So, what do you have to do then? Recollection.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the process of recollection, which involves returning to chanting, hearing, and remembrance after an interruption.
segments.transcript: what happens? You attempt to remember, chant, hear, remember, and some interruption comes. Again, you want to get back to that chanting, hearing and remembrance. So, what do you have to do then? Recollection. You have to attend to where you paused. You are reading Bhagavatam, something you have to attend to in between. You come back and resume from where you stopped. So, that is this recollection because of the interruption.

segments.key_quote: Of course, one should never imitate all these stages. As is told very clearly, imitating is very dangerous.
segments.summary: The speaker cautions against imitating advanced stages and emphasizes the importance of genuine progress, defining meditation as concentration upon the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord.
segments.transcript: Uninterrupted. Of course, one should never imitate all these stages. As is told very clearly, imitating is very dangerous. Just like somebody who wants to lazily sit and do now physical activity, to tell him do some service, he will say, oh no, I am engaged to you. You are not going to help us. Cheating is because they are lazy or they want to imitate advanced devotees, you see. So, that cheating should not be done. That is why, step by step, one should carefully progress one step at a time. And these things take time. Absorption, meditation, when you become absorbed in chanting and hearing always without interruption, then naturally your mind gets fixed on chanting and hearing. And that is exactly what is meditation. Prabhupada gives a definition of meditation in one purport in Bhagavatam that is concentration upon the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord.

segments.key_quote: By meditation, 24 hours a day, one has no other business or engagement for the mind than meditation. 24 hours a day, constant remembrance.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the progression from meditation to constant remembrance and finally to trance, where the mind is completely absorbed in one activity.
segments.transcript: So, somebody asked me, concentration upon the lotus feet of the Supreme Lord means should we try to keep a picture of the lotus feet of the deity in our mind? So, which is what brings me to this question? How to do this remembrance? If you speculate how to do remembrance, then you will try to imagine some or picturize something in the mind. That is not what is told, is the method. So, one should actually meditate on the lotus feet. So, that is meditation stage, sub-stage of smarana. Recollection, absorption, meditation. Then, the fourth one is constant remembrance. By meditation, 24 hours a day, one has no other business or engagement for the mind than meditation. 24 hours a day, constant remembrance. And that leads to trance, samadhi, total absorption in meditation. The mind is completely soaked up only in one activity. Only in one activity. No other activity.

segments.key_quote: So, the yaddus, it is described in the 10th canto, 90th chapter, the last chapter, they were so attached to Krishna that while eating, sleeping, talking, walking, doing their routine activities, always thinking of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of the Yadus and Brajavasis to illustrate constant remembrance of Krishna, leading to Samadhi (trance).
segments.transcript: So, the yadus, it is described in the 10th canto, 90th chapter, the last chapter, they were so attached to Krishna that while eating, sleeping, talking, walking, doing their routine activities, always thinking of Krishna. Same thing with Brajavasis. Brajavasis you already know. But have you heard this? You should read this in the 10th canto, 98th chapter. This is what Sukadeva Goswami described about yadus in Dwaraka. They were so attached to Krishna that their other bodily activities were done automatically without their specific attention on those activities. Oh, it is time to eat something? Okay, we will eat. But eating also, you see, constant remembrance leading to trance. That's why all these yadus, Brajavasis, they are always in Samadhi.

segments.key_quote: That which is the perfection of the Ashtanga Yoga for the Yogi which he may attain after millions and millions of years, he will be absolutely absorbed in such Samadhi for the Yadus, Brajavasis, pure devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Samadhi, which is difficult to attain through Ashtanga Yoga, comes easily to pure devotees due to their attachment to Krishna.
segments.transcript: That which is the perfection of the Ashtanga Yoga for the Yogi which he may attain after millions and millions of years, he will be absolutely absorbed in such Samadhi for the Yadus, Brajavasis, pure devotees. So easy because of specifically being attached to Krishna, Personality of Godhead. That's why Samadhi is required for such remembrance.

segments.key_quote: Remember Shravan Dasa Varana Dasa Smarana Dasa highest The soul comes to understand its original constitutional position.
segments.summary: The speaker reviews the stages of devotional progress: Shravan Dasa, Varana Dasa, Smarana Dasa, and Sampatti Dasa, where one realizes their constitutional position.
segments.transcript: Remember Shravan Dasa, Varana Dasa, Smarana Dasa, highest. The soul comes to understand its original constitutional position. This you have heard many times. What is my original constitutional position? Swaroopa. Each one has got a Swaroopa. So when will you know your Swaroopa? When you have perfected the third step according to this description. When you come to Varana Dasa, progresses to Smarana Dasa, perfection of Smarana Dasa, you come to know your constitutional position. This understanding one's or realizing one's constitutional position is called Sampatti Dasa. The Samarana Dasa leads to Sampatti Dasa. Then after this Sampatti

segments.key_quote: One can then serve spontaneously the lotus feet of Krishna without even following the regulated principles. This is the point.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that after Sampatti Dasa, one can serve spontaneously without regulated principles, which is Raga Bhakti.
segments.transcript: Dasa, one can then serve spontaneously the lotus feet of Krishna without even following the regulated principles. This is the point. Without even following the regulated principles, one can constantly always nicely serve Krishna's lotus feet. This is spontaneous devotion. Raga Bhakti. Raga Bhakti. See here, Sadhana Bhakti only. There is Vidhi Bhakti and there is Raga Bhakti. Hmm. Vidhi Bhakti is following the rules and regulations. But when following the rules and regulations, one is able to spontaneously render service. That is very important. But still, one has to follow some principles or regulations. What is that? At that stage, the devotee has to follow in the footsteps of one of the eternal associates of Krishna in particular devotee.

segments.key_quote: At that stage, the devotee has to follow in the footsteps of one of the eternal associates of Krishna in particular devotee.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that at this stage, the devotee must follow in the footsteps of an eternal associate of Krishna, based on their constitutional position (Shantarasa, Dasya, Sakya, Vatsalya, or Madhurya).
segments.transcript: One who is situated in Shantarasa should follow a devotee who is perfected that Shantarasa. One who is because the constitutional position will reveal our specific type of devotee. One who is situated in Shantarasa or Dasya or Sakya or Vatsalya or Madhurya. Accordingly, we have to select the particular perfect devotee in Vrindavan. And one has to take shelter of such a devotee and then render and follow in the footsteps of such a devotee. So, one has to take shelter of such a devotee. So, all these neophyte devotees jumping to some Babaji's instructions in Vrindavan. You know, Siddha Pranali. Some devotees did that during Prabhupada's physical presence, and even now some devotees keep doing that.

segments.key_quote: The fellow is not even able to chant properly 64 rounds every day. And he'll go to Vrindavan and he wants to take Siddha Pranali, some special mantra.
segments.summary: The speaker criticizes neophyte devotees who jump to advanced practices like Siddha Pranali without proper qualifications, emphasizing the importance of following Prabhupada's directions.
segments.transcript: The fellow is not even able to chant properly 64 rounds every day, and he'll go to Vrindavan and he wants to take Siddha Pranali, some special mantra. I heard one devotee in Vrindavan say that he wants to chant Vrindavan in Vrindavan. So, this of course eagerness may not be a wrong thing, but why before one becomes qualified should one even attempt Vrindavan? Where is Prabhupada giving us all these directions? How will we know our constitutional position? Prabhupada is clearly given here. Has he not given clearly? They won't read all these things and then say Prabhupada has not given us, not taught us. So, carefully studying Srila Prabhupada's books is so important. Only then we will realize Prabhupada has given us A to Z everything to achieve our goal.

segments.key_quote: One other place Prabhupada says, the spiritual master who initiates a devotee into chanting Hare Krishna and gives instructions for a devotee to progress in devotional service will reveal the Sambandha Jnana, constitutional position will be revealed at that time.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the spiritual master reveals Sambandha Jnana (constitutional position) through initiation and instructions for devotional service.
segments.transcript: One other place Prabhupada says, the spiritual master who initiates a devotee into chanting Hare Krishna and gives instructions for a devotee to progress in devotional service will reveal the Sambandha Jnana, constitutional position will be revealed at that time. What are the stages you have to go through? Sampatti Dasha you have to come to, the fourth stage. You have to go through Shravana Dasha, Varana Dasha, Smarana Dasha. Then after complete worship you have to patiently execute devotional service properly, following the rules and regulations. You cannot violate 64 principles of Vaidhi

segments.key_quote: You cannot violate 64 principles of Vaidhi Bhakti. You cannot violate.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of following the 64 principles of Vaidhi Bhakti and avoiding offences.
segments.transcript: Bhakti. You cannot violate. Obviously to come to perfection of Vaidhi Bhakti there are 64 offences. In chanting the Holy Name there is 10 offences. Nama Aparad, Seva Aparad, Vaishnava Aparad. So many Aparads are there. All that you have to give up. And then we have to follow the 64 principles of Vaidhi Bhakti. 64 different engagements for a devotee. It's for neophyte devotees. 64 engagements are there.

segments.key_quote: So we have to go through what are the 64 engagements and engage ourselves and Srila Prabhupada you can do all 64 activities.
segments.summary: The speaker suggests studying and engaging in the 64 activities of devotional service to control the restless mind.
segments.transcript: So we have to go through what are the 64 engagements and engage ourselves and Srila Prabhupada you can do all 64 activities. Why these 64 different activities have been listed? Because these 64 activities are varieties of Seva we can do. See our mind if you tell do only what is required absolute necessity no but then our mind is restless it is jumping around like a monkey even 16 rounds we cannot completely fix our mind uninterrupted way. We are trying to fix this and what are these varieties made of they are different types of engagement for the body mind and words all our activities are done with these three physical activities what are the varieties of mental activity

segments.key_quote: So you can take down an assignment go through the 64 activities and classify them which are physical variety belong to the physical variety which belong to the verbal variety and which are not physically like a physical physical activity
segments.summary: The speaker suggests classifying the 64 activities into physical, verbal, and mental categories to better understand and engage in devotional service.
segments.transcript: so you can take down an assignment go through the 64 activities and classify them which are physical variety belong to the physical variety which belong to the verbal variety and which are not physically like a physical activity and what are the physical development and physical activities to lead your mental activity this this is is the real thing that is the real thing which is the root of the fact is that we have to you see it's a serious business this devotional service ashram life doesn't

segments.key_quote: It's a serious business this devotional service ashram life doesn't mean vishram ashram doesn't mean vishram relaxing nicely no ashram means intense activity it's opposite of what people think of ashram outsiders when they think oh you're living in ashram it is just the opposite it's just the opposite
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that devotional service and ashram life are serious and involve intense activity, contrary to common misconceptions.
segments.transcript: mean vishram. Ashram doesn't mean vishram, relaxing nicely. No, ashram means intense activity. It's opposite of what people think of ashram. Outsiders when they think, oh you're living in ashram, it is just the opposite, it's just the opposite in at least in Krishna conscious moment it's the opposite that way you can safely say that's why our parents also sometimes can't understand what this boy will go and do 24 hours he'll be doing some bhajan marthira 24

segments.key_quote: who will give you food you were to work to work I said we are engaged in working proper told one reporter I am working more than you how many hours do you work I am working 18 hours how many was you are working so the reporter is completely you know taken aback they don't understand what this bhakti is all about
segments.summary: The speaker shares anecdotes about misconceptions regarding bhakti and devotional work, highlighting the dedication and effort involved.
segments.transcript: hours who will give you food one parent of one devotee who joined was asking who will give you food you were to work to work I said we are engaged in working proper told one reporter I am working more than you how many hours do you work I am working 18 hours how many was you are working so the reporter is completely you know taken aback they don't understand what this bhakti is all about

segments.key_quote: so many misconceptions even those who talk of bhakti outside they think something sentimental something mental that's are some emotion some feeling and the mind level feeling not at the soul level at the mind level that is not bhakti that's not true bhakti
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that true bhakti is not sentimental or mental but a soul-level connection, encouraging careful study for serious engagement in devotional service.
segments.transcript: so many misconceptions even those who talk of bhakti outside they think something sentimental something mental that's are some emotion some feeling and the mind level feeling not at the soul level at the mind level that is not bhakti that's not true bhakti so like this if you study carefully you'll get clear direction for actually seriously engaging and devotional service and making progress to actually reach the perfection of Krishna prema okay stop
